item.title: Introduction to Lightroom
item.description:
Introduction to Lightroom

These days, becoming a photographer is much more than just owning a DSLR camera and taking pictures whenever we want. We must learn from the very core of photography history about how to develop our own personal style by taking lessons from what masters of photography may tell us with their work, but learning to master the tools technology provides us is also an essential part of this process.

item.title: 20 Ways Photographers Can Offer Exceptional Customer Service
item.description:
20 Ways Photographers Can Offer Exceptional Customer Service

Let's face it: it's HARD to stand out in a photography market. You have a lot to think about: gear, Photoshop actions, pricing, profit, marketing, blogging, bookkeeping, social media, websites and design. Need I go on?

item.title: Framing Terminology for Professional Photographers
item.description:
Framing Terminology for Professional Photographers

As a professional photographer, customers who purchase your prints may come to you for advice on framing it-after all, you are the artist. To better serve these customers, you should be able to talk about the final end product: the mounted and framed print.

item.title: How To Get Your Photography Published and Gain Credibility
item.description:
How To Get Your Photography Published and Gain Credibility

Recently, I was talking to another fellow photographer at a local coffee shop, whom is very talented but still new. As we were sipping coffee the conversation changed and she asked me about different ways she could improve in her photography business.

item.title: Ultimate Tips for Vacation Rental Photography
item.description:
Ultimate Tips for Vacation Rental Photography

A market exists with millions of people in desperate need of photography. Professional photography will earn them tons of money, so they are willing to invest in your services. These clients are incredibly easy to find, by the hundreds and even thousands. Go take a look at the two largest vacation listing websites, HomeAway.com and AirBnB.com.

item.title: Three Ways Photographers Can Improve Their Online Presence
item.description:
Three Ways Photographers Can Improve Their Online Presence

The Internet is awash in imagery. The proliferation of smartphones has turned anyone with access to an iPhone into an armchair photographer ready and willing to share each and every photo he or she takes, no matter how mundane or inconsequential a photo may be.

item.title: The Keys to Successful Mini-Sessions
item.description:
The Keys to Successful Mini-Sessions

You see a photographer offering mini-sessions every 5 minutes on social media. It seems that people are flocking to them, but even if they sell out will they be profitable at the end of the day? Maybe you've tried to jump on the mini-session bandwagon, but ended the day exhausted and with little extra money in your business account.

item.title: How to Start a Photography Business
item.description:
How to Start a Photography Business

Congratulations on starting your photography business! This overview of how to start a photography business is perfect for the amateur photographer researching business opportunities, part-time photographer looking to expand, or a veteran pro who needs to revisit planning and marketing. The tutorial that follows is your road map (or GPS) to starting a successful photography business.

item.title: Getting Started on The Grid
item.description:
Getting Started on The Grid

Click the pencil icon in the bottom left to read more...
